content.description:
Image 1

Jan Steen, Dutch painter, The Burgher of Delft and his Daughter, 1655

In the Public Domain

The portrait most likely depicts the corn merchant Adolf Croeser and his daughter, Catharina. The burgher hears the plea of a begging widow and her son.

Image 2

Jan Steen, Dutch painter, The Dissolute Household, 1663-1664

Apsley House, The Wellington Museum, London,UK/Bridgeman Images
content.question: Which of the following best explains why Steen produced paintings like the one in image 1 for wealthy Dutch merchants?

choices.label: The merchants wished to show their Protestant rejection of Catholic imagery.
The merchants wished to show their support for the imposition of royal absolutism.
The merchants wished to show that their prosperity did not compromise their moral beliefs.
The merchants wished to show their knowledge of classical artistic styles and influences.

content.answer: The merchants wished to show that their prosperity did not compromise their moral beliefs.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience of a source.
